\title{\textcolor{black}{\normalsize{}Computer-predicted ionization energy
of carbon in agreement with experiment to within $1$~cm$^{-1}$}}
\selectlanguage{british}%

\author{Nike Dattani}
\email{dattani.nike@hertford.ox.ac.uk}

\selectlanguage{british}%

\affiliation{}
\selectlanguage{english}%

\date{\today}
\selectlanguage{british}%

\author{}

\author{}
\maketitle
\selectlanguage{english}%
\begin{center}
\begin{table*}
\caption{\label{tab:excitationEnergies-1}Ionization energies in cm$^{-1}$
listed according to order of appearance in the QED expansion in powers
of the fine structure constant $\alpha_{{\rm FS}}=\nicefrac{1}{137.035\,999\,074}$.
Carbon energies were done in this work using orbitals, whereas the
Li, Be, and B energies were calculated by Puchalski using explicitly
correlated $N$-electron wavefunctions. The scalar QED contribution
for carbon only includes the vacuum polarization and self-energy terms
comprising the Lamb-like shift. }

\begin{tabular*}{1\textwidth}{@{\extracolsep{\fill}}r@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}lr@{\extracolsep{0pt}.}l}
\hline 
\noalign{\vskip2mm}

\hline

\multicolumn{2}{c}{$m\alpha_{{\rm FS}}^{2}$} & 43~488&220~301(6) & 75~190&543(4) & 66~936&15(5) & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & 90~851&69(90) & \multicolumn{2}{c}{FCIQMC/aug-cc-pCV(\{7,8\}$\rightarrow\infty$)Z}\tabularnewline
\multicolumn{2}{c}{$m\alpha_{{\rm FS}}^{4}$} & 2&810~879 & 7&4140(8) & -10&131(2) & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multirow{2}{*}{-34&50} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{\multirow{2}{*}{SF(X2C + Breit + QED)}}\tabularnewline
\multicolumn{2}{c}{$m\alpha_{{\rm FS}}^{5}$} & \textminus 0&243~995 & -0&5577(3) & 1&59(20) & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{}\multirow{2}{*}{-34&50} & \multicolumn{2}{c}{\multirow{2}{*}{SF(X2C + Breit + QED)}} & \tabularnewline
